tone_and_voice: Use empathetic, respectful language that prioritizes patient trust and clarity.
Balance authority with warmth; avoid jargon unless context demands it, then explain simply.
Never overpromise medical outcomes; stay compliant and evidence-led.
brand_positioning: Highlight differentiators early (credentials, technology, access, outcomes).
Keep brand persona consistent with provided brand book or homepage tone cues.
Anchor benefits to patient or caregiver needs, not just features.
ethics_and_safety: Avoid diagnostic or curative claims; use supportive language (e.g., 'may help', 'can support').
Respect regulatory boundaries; no sensationalism or fear-based framing.
Protect privacy and avoid implying clinical advice; encourage professional consultation.
seo_and_aeo: Integrate primary and supporting keywords naturally within headings and body copy.
Write concise answers to common patient questions to support AEO/voice search.
Use scannable structure with descriptive H2/H3s and CTA clarity.
cta_and_structure: Include clear, low-friction CTAs aligned to intent (book, call, schedule consult).
Maintain logical flow: hero -> trust -> services -> proof -> FAQs -> CTA.
Keep paragraph length short (2-4 sentences) and favor bullet clarity when listing items.
